skill.name: subagent-development
skill.description: Execute plans using fresh subagent per task with code review between tasks. Use for high-quality iterative implementation.
skill.summary: Execute plans using fresh subagent per task with code review between tasks. Use for high-quality ite...
skill.author: DMJGilbert

security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation containing methodology guidelines for using subagents in development workflows. It contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no security risks. The content describes best practices for task delegation and code review processes.

content.user_title: Implement complex plans with fresh subagents and code reviews
content.value_statement: Complex development plans often fail due to accumulated context errors and missing quality checks. This methodology ensures each task gets a fresh subagent with clean context, followed by mandatory code review before proceeding.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step methodology for task delegation
Includes code review checkpoints between tasks
Defines quality gate criteria for pass/fail decisions
Offers templates for subagent prompts and reviews
Establishes critical rules for safe implementation
limitations: Depends on plan quality and task definition clarity
Adds overhead from frequent code reviews
May slow down simple changes that don't need isolation

use_cases.title: Implement multi-component features
use_cases.description: Break down complex features into isolated tasks, each implemented by fresh subagents with quality reviews

use_cases.title: Onboard new developers safely
use_cases.description: Use structured task delegation with built-in reviews to guide junior developers through complex implementations

use_cases.title: Maintain code quality alone
use_cases.description: Get external perspective through code reviewer subagents when working without human colleagues

prompt_templates.title: Basic Task Implementation
prompt_templates.scenario: First task in a feature implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement Task 1 from the plan: Create user authentication API. Follow TDD, write tests first, minimal code to pass. Output what was implemented and test results.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my implementation of user authentication API. Check if it matches requirements, code quality, test coverage. Identify any critical issues.

prompt_templates.title: Final Integration Review
prompt_templates.scenario: All tasks completed, ready for merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Final review of complete user authentication feature. Verify plan compliance, architectural soundness, no regressions. Ready for production?

prompt_templates.title: Issue Resolution
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the critical security issue identified in review: missing input validation. Update tests to cover edge cases. Re-review after fix.

output_examples.input: Implement user authentication API following the subagent methodology
output: Task 1: Created login endpoint with JWT token generation
Tests: 5 passing, 0 failing - covers success, invalid credentials, missing fields
Review: Passed - No critical issues, minor naming suggestions documented
Proceeding to Task 2: Password reset functionality

best_practices: Always use fresh subagents for each task to avoid context contamination
Never skip code reviews - they're your quality safety net
Document deferred issues instead of forgetting them
anti_patterns: Running multiple implementation subagents in parallel loses isolation benefits
Skipping reviews to save time creates technical debt
Implementing without referencing the plan causes drift from requirements

faq.question: Is this compatible with my existing development workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, it integrates with any workflow that uses task planning. You can adopt it gradually for complex features while keeping simple changes as-is.

faq.question: How many tasks should I break my plan into?
faq.answer: Aim for 2-4 hour tasks that produce working, testable code. Smaller tasks give better isolation but add review overhead.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The methodology is manual but produces commit-ready code. Each task completion creates a logical commit point for your pipeline.

faq.question: Is my code safe during the review process?
faq.answer: Yes, reviews happen on completed code in your repository. The subagent only reads and comments, never modifies without permission.

faq.question: What if the reviewer finds too many issues?
faq.answer: Fix critical issues immediately, high priority before next task. Medium/low issues can be batched if they don't block progress.

faq.question: How does this compare to pair programming?
faq.answer: It provides similar quality benefits asynchronously. You get external perspective without scheduling coordination, though human pairs offer deeper context.
